title: Content Judgment Calibrator – Sanity Specification
description: Machine-readable evaluation rules for auditing synthetic content judgment cases.

checks.question: Does the case conform to the required schema and enums?
checks.expected_behavior: All required fields present; enum values strictly respected.

checks.question: Does the dataset exhibit sufficient diversity of intent and persuasion types?
checks.expected_behavior: Balanced presence of neutral, persuasive, and mixed-intent cases.
failure_modes: Overrepresentation of a single persuasion technique

checks.question: Is ethical_risk_level proportional to the persuasion techniques used?
checks.expected_behavior: High risk reserved for identity, moral pressure, inevitability, or urgency framing.
failure_modes: High risk assigned to neutral framing

checks.question: Does the stated intent explain context without excusing persuasive influence?
checks.expected_behavior: Intent clarifies purpose without justifying weak credibility.
failure_modes: Intent used to excuse misleading framing
Perfect alignment in all cases (no tension)

checks.question: Is the model-facing rationale descriptive and non-prescriptive?
checks.expected_behavior: Rationales explain mechanisms without verdicts or corrections.

checks.question: Is tone and terminology consistent across cases?
checks.expected_behavior: Calm, editorial tone with consistent vocabulary.

checks.question: Do signature cases exhibit non-obvious, high-judgment ambiguity?
checks.expected_behavior: Signature cases invite interpretation without obvious verdicts.
failure_modes: No discernible distinction from regular cases

checks.question: Does the dataset allow ambiguity without over-flagging?
checks.expected_behavior: Some cases tolerate uncertainty and restraint.
